instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v on both ports, 0v on <SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_X</SIGNAL>/A/<SIGNAL>B_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Board had corrosion around <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>, <CHIP>U5810</CHIP> and <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> area but nothing major, all those components were removed and reballed, but board is still in the same state.

Board takes 5V and 0.050A

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> present on both <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>B_LDO</SIGNAL> present
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XA</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>B_LDOD</SIGNAL> present

<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XA</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>B_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> missing, no short and Diode reading is 0.510 on both

Already replaced <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> and <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> from donor board as well as the other chip under <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> that does not come up on boardview, but no change at all.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v on both ports, 0v on <SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_X</SIGNAL>/A/<SIGNAL>B_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Did you check all resistors and traces in that area?
Especially for <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> and <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.
Board should work without <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>; even having USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v on both ports, 0v on <SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_X</SIGNAL>/A/<SIGNAL>B_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Thanks, passed the board thru ultrasonic and found broken trace on a test point that connects one of the LDO lines.
